0;2144596662;"BlingClosby";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/reviews/id29657563";"8.3.1";5;"Slick kludge (not anymore)";"Update: Changed my rating from 2 stars for v. 8 to 4 stars for v. 8.3.1. Especially impressed by your response to user feedback. There is zero chance of my buying a HomePod or whatever it’s called now.
Archive this: Disappointing update people. I cannot understand how you’re getting 5 star reviews from anyone who’s used the controller for any length of time. First
column2: and forgetting the UI’s appearance for a second
column3: the move to privilege songs over albums is misguided. Choosing an album now gives me a mountain of icons for individual songs to choose from that album. It’s unclear how to just play an album or add an album to the queue with one click or a hard press as in prior versions. Also
column4: the Rooms navigation is awful. There used to be immediate access at the top of the screen to individual rooms. Navigating to the list now
column5: even with the button on the bottom is aggravating. It should always be available on screen. You have complicated the controller in many ways under the guise of simplifying the look of the interface. The interface is cleaner
column6: yes
column7: and I don’t mind the white as others do. What bugs me is that the cleanliness of the look destroyed the ease of use that was there up to now. I don’t want to fumble around relearning how to use the controller effectively. I just want to listen to music quickly and easily. I especially want to be able to play albums quickly and easily. Looking forward to version 9.";"2018-01-30T00:25:15-07:00";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/review?id=293523031&type=Purple%20Software";"293523031";260;"en";"POSITIVE"

column1: 1;3763571887;"Vettagozo";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/reviews/id125833762";"10.0.1";5;"New beginnings with the Beam";"Okay... we had a 10 year old Sony 46” Bravia TV and Bose Acoustimass 15 home theater speakers run through a Sony amp. So we decided to move up to a LG 65” c8 television. Love it
column2: but that’s another review. The Bose was great for music but was always problematic trying to get it working properly for surround sound. The Sony and Bose never really jived with each other. So as a result we seldom used it. Anyway
column3: friends told me about Sonos speakers and since we had the new TV I decided to purchase the Beam sound bar
column4: the sub woofer and two play 1 speakers to make a surround system for the new LG. Man it sounds great. We are very please with the system and the ease of setup and use. It is pricey when it comes to the sub woofer. However the sub really completes the system so I would say if you can swing it $$$
column5: go for it. We chose the Beam over the larger Sonos sound bar because the Beam has a HDMI hook up with “ARC” and Alexa built in if that’s important to you. I just didn’t want a optical connection that the bigger Sonos bar only comes with. However I would guess the larger sound bar probably sounds better.??? However don’t let the size of the Sonos Beam fool you
column6: it's impressive. Anyway I can’t wait to add more speakers to our house later on. Very satisfied customer.";"2019-02-12T18:55:49-07:00";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/review?id=293523031&type=Purple%20Software";"293523031";249;"en";"POSITIVE"

column1: 2;3141802632;"Velolion57";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/reviews/id214377996";"9.0";4;"Work around for 9.0?";"I’ve been a Sonos user since very early on. I have two Play:1 speakers that I use as a stereo pair. I was very disappointed when the v9.0 update
column2: which apparently enabled Air Play on the One (plus other current models)
column3: disabled the home screen controls for those of us using the legacy speakers. I’ve also experienced the same as others where the last ~20 seconds of each track would be cut off when I was playing from a locked iOS device. I keep nearly all my audio on my iPhone & iPad and generally play straight from those devices’ libraries instead of from my Mac
column4: as the latter spends most of its time in sleep mode.

column1: Surprisingly I just accidentally got the lock screen controls re-enabled and the end-of-track cutoff seems to have gone away. For some reason one of my speakers dropped off the system and I couldn’t get it to reconnect
column2: so I did a full-on controller reset on my iPhone. I also unplugged both speakers and then basically set my system back up
column3: as if it was new. No idea why
column4: but like I said this has caused the end-of-track dropout to go away and my lock screen controls to come back (even though Sonos says explicitly in their release notes that this function has gone away for those without Air Play compatible speakers).

column1: Very weird
column2: but now my system’s back to how I’ve used and loved it for the past 6-7 years and it’s great! Hopefully some others might try this and have some luck getting full functionality back.";"2018-09-01T09:59:42-07:00";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/review?id=293523031&type=Purple%20Software";"293523031";264;"en";"POSITIVE"

column1: 3;5812865710;"Bob S. in Sausalito";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/reviews/id36175040";"11.0";4;"Would be 5 stars if I appreciated a bait and switch.";"Over the years
column2: I have built a Sonos system with speakers throughout my home
column3: a significant investment.  I have also accumulated a library of thousands of titles
column4: expecting to listen to my purchased music via Sonos
column5: a functionality that made the hardware investment worthwhile.  On the positive side
column6: Sonos has gradually solved most of the bugs that would inexplicably fail to connect or randomly break connection with my WiFi or with my iphone.  But the unwelcome news that Sonos would cease to play titles “on this phone” felt like a real ripoff - a classic bait and switch.  It is redundant and wasteful to pay dues to a music streaming service when I already “own” the music I want to hear.  Had I known that Sonos would block me from listening to my own music
column7: I would never have invested in the system.  This is why
column8: when friends ask me whether they should buy Sonos
column9: I now recommend rather that they purchase a set of high end Bluetooth speakers.  I will be surprised if the good folks at Sonos publish this review
column10: as it is anything but the hands-down accolade I’m sure they would prefer.  But if they are serious about building consumer loyalty and serving and growing their customer base
column11: they will thank their subscribers for their invaluable feedback and reinstate the “on this phone” functionality.";"2020-04-14T19:03:09-07:00";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/review?id=293523031&type=Purple%20Software";"293523031";227;"en";"POSITIVE"

column1: 4;1848786345;"Pctomfor";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/reviews/id31769707";"8.0";5;"New version UI is poor.  Used to be 5*";"Revised 10/14 on new version.  I hate the new layout. I do not find it intuitive and still struggle to figure out how to pick music to play in a particular room. Also
column2: My favorites used to scroll vertically
column3: making them easy to sort through as I could see many of them on the screen at the same time. Now they scroll horizontally and have huge icons
column4: meaning I can only see one station at a time.  This app used to be 5star worth and set it apart from the crowd.

column1: Original review:
I seem to keep finding reasons to expand my system
column2: it gets pretty addictive.  I mostly use Pandora or other internet radio type stations. Streaming music to a speaker via Bluetooth is not the same!  The speakers are more like today's smart TV's
column3: with apps built in that run autonomously
column4: the phone is just a remote control.  Software navigation is incredibly easy and the speakers all sound amazing! I have a Play 1 in both my bedroom and home office
column5: a Play 5 in my living room
column6: a Playbar/Sub/Play1 surround system hooked to my Sony Bravia TV in the family room
column7: and am waiting on a connect amp to arrive for my outdoor speakers.  They can all play different stations
column8: or group them together as needed during house parties.";"2017-10-14T10:31:31-07:00";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/review?id=293523031&type=Purple%20Software";"293523031";222;"en";"POSITIVE"

column1: 5;2532968177;"philkloose";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/reviews/id215317492";"8.5.2";5;"Updated: I love Sonos. The app isn't perfect
column2: but it's acceptable.";"Updated: I don't know that I'll ever love the new app design but they've definitely improved it since my last 2-star review. The Sonos experience as a whole is 5 stars. I love these devices
column3: plain and simple.

column1: Original Review: I'm split on this review
column2: obviously. It's tempting to defiantly throw up a 1-star review and walk away without explanation but that would be unfair to a product that really is a standout. I've been a Sonos evangelist for years and years. The system has always been rock solid and the app intuitive -- flawless hardware and software. That all changed with the latest major version of the app. It's so confounding to those of us that have loved this product for years.  I don't care that it's white -- stupid quibble. People can get over that. But the actual interactions I have with it while trying to play music in different rooms never seem to get easier. I eventually get what I want but it's not before cursing the new app several times for tricking me into the wrong area.

column1: I want so badly for Sonos to acknowledge their error and revert to the older-style navigation. It would be an easy 5-star review from me again.";"2018-05-11T08:24:27-07:00";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/review?id=293523031&type=Purple%20Software";"293523031";207;"en";"POSITIVE"

6;3055310068;"SMH931";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/reviews/id493581089";"9.0";1;"Disappointed";"It’s a shame when you haven’t even had the chance to use the speaker and your already having problems. It just so happens that Sonos doesn’t have tech support available on the weekends to assist when the average human is needing it. I’m disappointed at the fact that I thought it would be a nice touch to bring the speaker to a bridal shower at a friends house for entertainment purposes. Connected it to the WiFi at her house
column2: finally got everything setup and then couldn’t even use it because the speaker couldn’t just link to pandora without having my password. I couldn’t remember it to save my life. So I get it home the next day
column3: and try to re-setup the speaker on the network in my house
column4: thinking that this wouldn’t be so difficult according to the instruction video in the app/controller. I’ve unplugged the speaker
column5: the router
column6: plugged the Ethernet cable into a wireless router and the Internet box directly from the ISP
column7: and nothing will work to have the speaker setup on my own network. The app/Controller instructs you to plug the Ethernet cable up and then wait for the mysterious green light that never comes on or to go to advanced settings which doesn’t appear anywhere in the app
column8: or my personal favorite when the app tells you to select the SONOS wireless network that doesn’t appear. So lesson learned don’t take your Sonos anywhere and set it up unless you plan to leave it there!!! Because you won’t be able to set it up anywhere else!!!";"2018-08-12T11:49:59-07:00";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/review?id=293523031&type=Purple%20Software";"293523031";262;"en";"POSITIVE"

column1: 7;3970812117;"bevyb2000";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/reviews/id42495139";"10.1";3;"App Needs More Features";"I love the sound I get from my speakers
column2: but the review isn’t really about the speakers. It’s about the app
column3: which needs some work. The ability to access multiple audio sources is great. What it is missing though are the small details that make the apps from those services it is drawing from a better option almost every time. For instance
column4: the Pandora app lets you view songs that have already played - so
column5: if you were away from the device and heard a new song and want to know more about it
column6: you could check later to see what it was. With the Sonos app
column7: if you don’t check while the song is playing you will never know. With the Books from Audible
column8: it’s great that you can play it in multiple rooms but losing the ability to speed up the playback means I won’t use that service here. The same (or worse) with Apple podcasts. The only way to access them is via the On This Phone option. Unfortunately
column9: it doesn’t tap into the organization that the iPhone uses and just puts everything out there in a mess so if you have multiple episodes to listen to
column10: it’s just a huge mess. This also needs the speed up option that the regular podcast apps offer. Again
column11: I love my speakers and the music I play on them sounds amazing. However
column12: I really hope the app gets some good upgrades soon.";"2019-04-04T19:34:34-07:00";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/review?id=293523031&type=Purple%20Software";"293523031";243;"en";"POSITIVE"

column1: 8;3538820537;"hernahhhhluvsbagels";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/reviews/id563195495";"9.3.1";1;"Unexpected Dissatisfaction";"My family has been a frequent costumer of Sonos

column3: the sound bar
column4: we have been very pleased with our (expensive
column5: yet) great quality speakers. They will cut out every now and then
column6: most noticeable during movies
column7: but that was only a slight annoyance compared to what we are dealing with now. Perhaps it is part of a new update (we have the latest version
column8: so the app being outdated should not be an issue)
column9: or simply the app crashing
column10: meaning it will be back up and running within a week hopefully. But
column11: since this morning
column12: Sonos has let us down. An overall irritation
column14: and not what we paid for! The speakers (rooms) have been unable to group
column16: despite the loud volume it is set on (they are also all plugged in). We could select a song or artist or radio to play
column17: but the speaker will simply not react whatsoever. Being a loyal patron of Sonos
column18: my family and I are frustrated and hope this issue is resolved quickly

column1: But to those interested in purchasing one or more Sonos speakers

column3: making it so that when they suddenly fail to do what they are supposed to

column1: 9;1943179351;"Tomarti";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/reviews/id107254515";"8.2.1";5;"Upgrade is Horrible";"I have owned Sonos from it’s inception.  My two dozen speakers are used at my home

column1: The new interface is non intuitive and confusing.  Actually
column2: it is COUNTER INTUITIVE. My friends
column3: family and office staff have turned against me for providing them a monster of a music system.   I am now the one asked to tune in the music that they desire because no one can figure it out (or don’t have the time to try to figure it out).  Then I embarrassingly struggle to fulfill their request
column4: and screw it up anyway.

column1: However
column2: not all hope is lost!  Sonos
column3: if you want me to give you the five stars that you really deserve
column4: fire the individual in charge of this most recent downgrade. Please post a photo of them exiting the building carrying their personal items in a cardboard box.

column1: Then get the app back to the way it was
column2: with a few interface tweaks that are intuitive.

column1: Sonos
column2: this is the “New Coke” of the 21st Century (look it up Millennials). You can fix it!";"2017-11-23T08:59:00-07:00";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/review?id=293523031&type=Purple%20Software";"293523031";211;"en";"POSITIVE"

column1: 10;5534313985;"ddm5055";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/reviews/id191439002";"10.6.2";4;"Speakers = Amazing
column2: App... okay";"I’ve used Sonos speakers for well over 5 years now and simply love the sound and audio. High quality speakers thought your home is a game changer. The app on the other hand
column3: could use some renovation. If you search for a popular artists name to find a specific album
column4: you’ll be greeted with a cluster of disorganized censored albums
column5: uncensored albums
column6: song singles
column7: and song features. Nothing is organized by year or date. It would be nice to be able to click an album
column8: then have a toggle button that changes it from censored to uncensored. It would make things more user friendly. My second recommendation would be about the layout. For such a smooth speaker product line
column9: the app seems really square and blocky. Lastly
column10: a touch of Dark mode to make the inter interface black might just be a personal preference
column11: however we’ve all seen the success Apple has had implementing a dark mode for their devices. It’s more pleasing on the eyes and would also make the entire app look like the logo. Again
column13: however when it takes me more than 3 minutes to find a single song (in this world of instant gratification) it doesn’t make me too happy.";"2020-02-15T04:15:05-07:00";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/review?id=293523031&type=Purple%20Software";"293523031";208;"en";"POSITIVE"

column1: 11;3179976726;"disappointed_reader";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/reviews/id23226262";"9.1";2;"Updates frequently break the iPad app";"The latest one simply removed the ability to play anything anywhere. Awesome!
Update: one of my favorite features is that Sonos can almost never process any command without restarting the app. And even more fun
column2: the play/pause button is unreliable after it restarts. It may be playing but only offer “play
column3: ” or it may be paused and only offer “pause.”  Leaving the house and want to turn off the music on the way out the door?  Better sit down
column4: maybe pour a drink. I left the music on all night recently because of this. I left convinced that it was off after at least a minute of toggling and waiting. Silly me. One must
column5: I guess
column6: use multiple devices to verify that a simple “pause” command was evaluated correctly.

column1: Another great feature is the frequency of updates. I wish the updates would fix the problems
column2: but they only seem to compound them. The annoying update notification inevitably lists something I don’t care about and then breaks some basic functionality. Whom exactly are you catering to
column3: Sonos?  Your customers?  Someone else?  What gives?  Great
column4: now Sonos works with all this stuff I don’t have or even want
column5: but can’t manage any single task without a complete restart. You are optimizing for the wrong priorities. Take care of your customers or we will leave and never come back.";"2018-09-11T21:07:14-07:00";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/review?id=293523031&type=Purple%20Software";"293523031";226;"en";"POSITIVE"

column1: 12;2973965590;"Scooter 82";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/reviews/id30508404";"9.0";1;"Used to be great but not anymore";"The Sonos system used to be great but the latest updates have totally screwed my system. Although my ZP100 is wired
column2: streaming radio drops out all the time when it never did before. The volume sometimes goes to zero
column3: no input required. I haven’t been able to access the music library on my home server for years even though every other system in my house can access it. And now they’re going to disable the Sonos remote that I own because apparently they own it. I was a Sonos fan from the beginning but no more.

column1: Update: Sonos has lost their way. With each successive release of the software more features are removed. I used to be able to see Sonos on my lock screen and adjust the volume. No more. (Yes I’ve seen the remarks about having other audio programs open which I closed although I didn’t have to do this before.) I used to be able to open the app and adjust the volume with the hardware buttons but now they’re stupid buttons and need to be pressed multiple times before they recognize they’ve been pressed. Changing rooms
column2: overly complicated now. If you’re on the fence about buying a Sonos system I recommend that you don’t do it. What was once the best sound system available
column3: bar none
column4: is now an also ran due to the way they’ve crippled their app and forced you off the physical remote which still worked perfectly.";"2018-07-26T13:59:51-07:00";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/review?id=293523031&type=Purple%20Software";"293523031";244;"en";"NEGATIVE"

column1: 13;2956968344;"nickrTN";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/reviews/id206624309";"9.0";3;"Great When It Works";"We put Sonos in our new construction home three years ago
column2: and while the concept is fantastic
column3: we’ve had several issues in the three years since it’s installation.  The two most frustrating issues have been:

column1: 1) It does not sync perfectly with the music library on the device from which you’re operating it from; for example
column2: I tend to use my iPad Pro with my ENTIRE music library on the device in iTunes
column3: yet there are several songs that cannot be found through the Sonos app
column4: and after spending several hours and multiple calls to Sonos tech support they blame iTunes and threw their hands up. The music is clearly on my device yet the Sonos app can’t “see” all of the music “on this device”
column5: very frustrating!

column1: 2) Often when we go to use the Sonos app on any of our devices (2 iPhones and 1 iPad) it cannot connect to the network and will not come up on the device
column2: suggesting that you reboot the router.  This is a hassle and inconvenience
column3: and it happens about 50% of the time.

column1: Overall
column2: love the concept and it’s great WHEN it works
column3: but it’s quirks and functionality have made me question whether it was truly worth the investment we made when there are so many Bluetooth devices and streaming services available on the market.";"2018-07-23T14:31:45-07:00";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/review?id=293523031&type=Purple%20Software";"293523031";224;"en";"POSITIVE"

column1: 14;3755953440;"Sky walker929";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/reviews/id416981295";"10.0";5;"So far very impressed";"So far I’m very impressed with the capability of the app itself. The Sonos Playbar I bought is a dream when listening to music and watching movies. The app itself is limited but I can totally get by with what it offers for the time being. I mostly use Apple Music
column2: Pandora and Soundcloud. So it’s kinda weird but they are apps within an app. It’s confusing to describe but it feels like second nature when navigating thru the app. Best part is while I’m playing music on the Playbar I can still watch videos on my phone so not to disrupt anyone else listening to music. I usually pop in my AirPods and watch a quick video on FB or FaceTime and the music still plays. This is probably my favorite feature. I have no regrets and I’m sure it only gets better from here. By the way the sound quality is absurdly wonderful. I hear things I usually don’t ever hear on just about anything else. I have an open concept living room and it fills the entire room effortlessly! I must purchase the subwoofer to complete the ensemble but I have to recover from the grip I just let go of on the Playbar but it is definitely in the near future!";"2019-02-10T17:06:56-07:00";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/review?id=293523031&type=Purple%20Software";"293523031";215;"en";"POSITIVE"

column1: 15;4387776966;"st96t3h6";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/reviews/id20307706";"10.2.3";5;"Great for Audiophiles and Newbies Alike!";"I am a father of four boys and waited a long time (goodbye diapers!) to buy my home audio solution. I own five (gen 1) Ones
column2: a Playbar and a Connect Amp and have been very happy with all of them. The Amp drives two Bose 301 outdoor speakers out by the pool and it effortlessly fills the entire yard with sound. The Playbar and two of the Ones are my “home theatre” and surprisingly provide a lot bass for the bass-starved flatscreen in our living room. The other Ones hang in our home gym
column3: if that’s what you call a room with a treadmill and a weight bench
column4: and provide awesome audio for those few and far between workouts.

column1: Long story short
column2: these components provide excellent audio quality at a nice price and are modular so a guy on a budget can add pieces little by little. Pure audiophiles may snub their noses at these
column3: but the increasing quality of audio sources make these an excellent choice for any room
column4: situation and budget. I have a recommend Sonos products to anybody looking to get into this space at a reasonable price. The cost may be entry-level
column5: but the quality is much greater. I can’t wait to get my Sub!";"2019-06-29T12:38:25-07:00";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/review?id=293523031&type=Purple%20Software";"293523031";210;"en";"POSITIVE"

column1: 16;5475577538;"I TRS Gear I";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/reviews/id30775477";"10.6.2";3;"It’s just... Okay (in app music searches kills the score)";"Listen
column2: you’re shoehorned into using this app; regardless of whether you like it or not. That’s the price we pay I guess
column3: for the luxury of having some of the best sounding speakers on the market.

column1: This app has multiple functions beyond just controlling your music. It’s also the tool used for calibrating your speakers and adding new ones to the ecosystem. It handles these tasks fairly well. When it comes to navigating your music
column2: it’s just... okay. I can fairly simply choose to play different music in different rooms
column3: which is cool. However I noticed I regularly just end up using AirPlay instead of the app; all because the search functionality is just awful.

column1: I could go into iOS music app
column2: search for an artist
column3: and be delivered literally everything I want from that artist. If I do the same in this Sonos app
column4: I often scroll until I get so frustrated not being a old to find a song or album I want that I just end up going back to AirPlay again through the iOS music app. Same frustrations go for every style of search
column5: be it album
column6: song
column7: playlist... the Sonos app very rarely offers me the music I want to hear from a simple search.";"2020-02-01T10:41:43-07:00";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/review?id=293523031&type=Purple%20Software";"293523031";210;"en";"POSITIVE"

column1: 17;3079663219;"Marghana";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/reviews/id29199898";"9.0";3;"Clean and simple but a little unstable";"While the Sonos speakers themselves sound good for what they are
column2: that quality was the second priority behind my purchase. The value in Sonos lies in the app and the SonosNet that the speakers create and cast. The system is remarkably convenient and has allowed to me enhance and rejuvenate a very good but aging setup. On this aspect alone I would contribute five stars.

column1: The rub
column2: however
column3: is in the application. While
column4: for the most part
column5: the app/SonosNet interface and communication work well
column6: there are irritating moments of dysfunction. The problem that I most often encounter is that the app will fail to communicate with the speakers for intermittent periods of time during which I cannot remotely control the components of my system. Less often
column7: but proportionally more irritating
column8: is when the sound from my Sonos Connect (which I use to port my home theatre into the SonosNet) will drop out repeatedly during a Netflix binge. This usually coincides with the previous problem and the two together constitute a significant disruption to the system’s functionality.

column1: While the app works well and (for the most part) easily
column2: small but significant interludes of instability lead me to lower my rating alongside my satisfaction.";"2018-08-17T19:02:40-07:00";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/review?id=293523031&type=Purple%20Software";"293523031";202;"en";"NEGATIVE"

column1: 18;5704250068;"Hjdjdjjx";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/reviews/id349855748";"11.0";1;"Great service. Horrible app";"The concept of Sonos is great. Adding any/all music services to 1 platform that can play through the wifi and in sync sounds amazing … If the app ever connects. I’ve had Sonos for several years and the entire time I’ve had the same problem and they haven’t seemed to fix it. The app is extremely unreliable. “Can not connect to your Sonos network” is the message of my nightmares that I see 5 times a day. I will literally turn on a station on Sonos
column2: walk away for 5 minutes and when I come back I can’t use the app because it won’t connect. (I’ve had this problem in multiple house with different WiFi’s) The system is working because music is playing it’s just the app says it cannot connect. column1: Tried everything including a two hour “support” session with Sonos. Nothing but an admission that AirPlay is “hard to implement AND yet maintain control over the data”. I know it’s getting old to complain about but the insatiable business model focused more on how to monetize users and user’s data than simply developing a good product is getting ridiculous and it’s preventing consumers from getting what they expect and pay for.

AirPlay 2 support for Airport Express is going to really hurt Sonos if they don't get this figured out quick! I just dusted off a few I had laying about. Saved me $600 (and lost Sonos the sales) since I already have good “dumb” speakers. My advice to Sonos: worry less about trying to make speakers “smart” and worry more about putting audio playback in its modern form (read:digital/streaming) first!";"2018-08-28T14:03:33-07:00";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/review?id=293523031&type=Purple%20Software";"293523031";199;"en";"NEGATIVE"

column1: I've become a huge Sonos fan and wish I'd tried out the system years instead of mere months ago. I wish I could control the volume on my locked phone from the phone volume buttons as I can with the Apple music app

column1: 24;1953396556;"Dishaddicted";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/reviews/id194411135";"8.2.1";4;"If you're not happy with Sonos - Call Support - Free & US based";"Pros:

We have had Sonos for over two years. We have 13 speakers throughout our house. It is the best thing ever! Recommend it to all my friends and usually have them come over to hear the system. For those of you having connection & disconnect problems please call their US-based technical support team FOR FREE! They are incredible! They will spend as much time as necessary to get your system up and running properly including running remote diagnostics. I wish other companies had such wonderful support for their products. I understand they have FREE lifetime telephone support as long as you own their product. How great is that?
Cons:

Sonos keeps changing their apps. It used to be so simple and wonderful to use. Then they came out with their new version of the app which is so much more complicated and harder to find where certain menus are located. I don't understand why they have to keep relocating menus....leave well enough alone! You had a great app and menus were very easy to find. (I still highly recommend the product!)";"2017-11-27T12:38:20-07:00";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/review?id=293523031&type=Purple%20Software";"293523031";182;"en";"POSITIVE"

column1: 31;3571276081;"GTR4Dove";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/reviews/id20623280";"9.3.1";3;"Love Sonos...not Crazy about the app";"I have had Sonos since it was first introduced. column2: but for everyday use it is a pain. Unless you have something saved in your shortcuts
column3: you have to rethink how to select and find music channels that I want. I consider myself somewhat technology literate and find myself pausing trying to figure out how to do things.  For people who are confused easily by technology  this app will drive you crazy. I know .... I hear from my wife all the time.  I think Sonos needs to use the KISS methodology (keep it simple stupid ) and redesign this app and let the average person test it and not a bunch of engineers. column1: 32;1905090090;"Ter Jer";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/reviews/id12705843";"8.1.1";4;"Speakers are great this update is infuriating";"This update of the app is disappointing for three reasons. First the UI has changed making it more difficult to navigate through two rooms and the primary view for your playlists and favorites only shows a handful you need to click show all to see your entire lists. Second it seems to be performing less reliably than before. Rooms are dropped the last played audio is forgotten and groupings are frequently forgotten. Finally this app insists that you register a Sonos account in order to use all the features. This is absolutely ridiculous. It was working fine without a proprietary Sonos account before there is no new feature I need that should require a Sonos account. I do not want to sign up for another account on some other companies website that can be hacked or preached or used to harvest my personal information ways that I can’t control. I would much prefer that all the information at Sonos needs to be stored locally on either one of my controllers or on some of the hardware.";"2017-11-07T19:01:26-07:00";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/review?id=293523031&type=Purple%20Software";"293523031";176;"en";"NEGATIVE"

column3: difficult-to-use app that frustrates me every time I open it. Many of the features present in the PC and Mac Interface are simply not available in the IPAD App. In both the PC and Mac Interface
column4: one can no longer add Pandora Stations to the list of stations - they must go into “SONOS Favorites” instead. Context-sensitive features that used to be available via the “...” link on each page have now been moved to other non-intuitive parts of the tool
column5: or have disappeared completely. Major podcasts with hundreds of thousands or even millions of users are not available through the Sonos search feature
column6: and they’ve been added to the “My Radio Shows” section
column7: which is somehow confusingly distinct from the “Podcasts” section. Sonos
column8: you had something that worked pretty well before. May I request in all seriousness that you go back to the drawing board and earnestly begin work on a rebuild
column9: based on actual users and user groups
column10: and flush this current version down the toilet as soon as possible?";"2019-02-03T19:54:29-07:00";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/review?id=293523031&type=Purple%20Software";"293523031";186;"en";"NEGATIVE"

column1: 40;1781938332;"gw52";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/reviews/id39384389";"7.4";5;"Works as advertised...Great!";"Over the past 3 years I have acquired the SONOS products to include the Play 1 and Play 5
column2: several Connects and several SONOS Amps to control music throughout the house. It has allowed me to use some of my legacy speakers very effectively.

column1: The controller app works well but I am a tech person so easily understand some of the nuances to the features. My wife can use it well enough to play her favorites as well. I will note that as more features are added to the controller app
column2: it gets more complicated and those technically challenged don't find it as easy to navigate the controls. Great products though and the sound can be perfectly matched to any room.

column1: One issue I discovered is that SiriusXM limits the number of simultaneous streams so if you are trying to play a channel in multiple rooms you will get a message cutting off the stream. I think their max is 2 or 3 simultaneous. Pandora works well for whole house events.";"2017-09-09T05:54:19-07:00";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/review?id=293523031&type=Purple%20Software";"293523031";171;"en";"POSITIVE"

41;5854568665;"Paper-weights";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/reviews/id535014068";"11.1";1;"Average speakers terrible software";"Sonos makes average speakers. They make terrible software and should seriously think out outsourcing it to someone else. They update their terrible software on a frequent basis
column2: not to fix bugs but to introduce more bugs and take features away with each revision.  This would be so bad if they didn’t lock the app and force you to upgrade their app to play songs through the software.

column1: I’ve had the product for about 2 and a half years. When I first purchased it I could play songs on my speakers. I could even play the songs I had purchased and downloaded to my device from iTunes. Now slowly but surely
column2: with each forced update to their software
column3: that is required to use the speakers I’ve bought and paid for
column4: they have whittled down the sources from where you can play music. These updates have also added “features” that cause the app to stop playing music to the correct speaker
column5: stop play music at the correct volume
column6: or just stop playing music all together. All thanks to the glorious mandated software and it’s many forced updates. I basically have four $500 paper weights now.

column1: Buyer beware.";"2020-04-23T15:06:22-07:00";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/review?id=293523031&type=Purple%20Software";"293523031";195;"en";"POSITIVE"

42;1888067842;"Kirk K2013";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/reviews/id23462254";"8.1";4;"Horrible app update for a great system";"The usability of the latest app update is just terrible. It's hard to believe this was actually green-lighted by the Sonos product team. The new UX makes it very frustrating for long time customers to figure out how to use the system in a multi (5) speaker household. It's a pain to find/select favorites
column2: switch between speakers
column3: etc. Other reviews have already covered the main usability challenges so I won't rehash. I trust that the Sonos product/UX team is working hard to address  these issues (hopefully putting ego aside). 2 stars only for now till these serious usability problems are fixed in a subsequent update. Good luck.

column1: Previous review from ~2 years ago:
The Sonos app has been much improved over the past 6 months with the latest few updates
column2: both in terms of usability and interaction design as well as in support of additional music sources.  The Sonos system itself is top notch -- smooth
column3: uninterrupted audio play with great sound.";"2017-10-31T10:23:33-07:00";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/review?id=293523031&type=Purple%20Software";"293523031";163;"en";"POSITIVE"

column1: 43;5379606032;"solidosnaku";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/reviews/id40131292";"10.6.1";1;"User interface";"This app wastes so much space on useless or infrequently used items in the settings page like having a separate front page button for privacy and legal which both could easily been put under app settings but still refuse to put back alarms which is a feature many people use on a daily bases. I was originally going to wait on writing a review until after they released their fix for burying the alarms
column2: but now that it’s out the new “shortcut” to alarms is still just as convoluted. The frustrating part is that on the settings page where alarms used to be
column3: half of the page is blank and what is there are 7 sections that are rarely used if at all (like legal)
column4: and this wouldn’t be too big of an issue if the settings page wasn’t automatically the one page that pops up every time you open the app. If they don’t want to put alarms on the front page of settings that’s fine but at least let me change the “home page” of the app allowing it to open on the rooms page whenever I launch the app so that way I have access to the only 2 features I use more than once a year... music & alarms.";"2020-01-08T23:38:08-07:00";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/review?id=293523031&type=Purple%20Software";"293523031";213;"en";"NEGATIVE"

column1: 44;2047516517;"The Kenosha Kid";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/reviews/id24664915";"8.2.2";2;"Amazing system
column2: difficult app that keeps getting worse";"The Sonos system itself has literally no real competition
column3: so there's nothing much to say there. If you want an integrated wireless hifi system for your house that actually works
column4: and supports all the major streaming/storage providers it’s the only game in town.

column1: The controller app
column2: however
column3: is a rolling disaster that manages to keep getting worse with each subsequent redesign. The latest major update apes the design of the iOS music app but it’s just an impossibly poor fit: there are two separate “room” interfaces and you will always
column4: inevitably
column5: pick the wrong one for the action you want to do. Volume controls are hidden in a slide-up “now playing” card which
column6: when expanded
column7: hides the shortcut links to everything.  Getting simple things done is like swimming through molasses: someone at Sonos needs to sit down and do some actual user testing for this stuff.

column1: The good news is that they’ve mostly ignored the OS X/windows controller applications
column2: so the interface there is still actually usable. And like I said
column3: it’s the only game in town so what are you gonna do?";"2018-01-01T08:45:52-07:00";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/review?id=293523031&type=Purple%20Software";"293523031";183;"en";"NEGATIVE"

column1: 45;1862967866;"mawheatley";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/reviews/id149492198";"8.1";4;"Latest update is awful!";"Omg this is terrible!  I wish there was a way to uninstall this latest update!  We have (had!) three rooms on this system. Since the update the only way to switch off one of the rooms was to pull the power cord!  What kind of control is that?  And I suppose that means this room is now unusable!  This really needs to be addressed - I paid a lot of money for this system!

UPDATE:  it has taken a little while to get used to the new UI. I will also say the the new version was a lot more temperamental with Google Wifi - because the four speakers were reaching different access points it was hit and miss. However Google recently updated Google Wifi and that made things a lot better. I also plugged one of the speakers into an access point ethernet
column2: which creates a dedicated Sonos network
column3: and everything is now perfect again!  I've changed the review to 4 stars. I still don't like the new UI
column4: but in all fairness the whole system really does work extremely well.";"2017-10-20T16:15:14-07:00";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/review?id=293523031&type=Purple%20Software";"293523031";182;"en";"POSITIVE"

column1: 46;2304140321;"Sbeeghley";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/reviews/id5160083";"8.4";5;"Sound is great but customer service is a disaster";"Love the sound and the app overall works well. Sonos customer service
column2: however
column3: is really bad. They obviously make it difficult to speak to someone or quickly resolve a problem. And they are closed on weekends. Joy. Our Sonos players are frozen as part of an update (8.4). The trouble shooting didn’t solve the problem and there is no way to play music. I guess we won’t be playing music at our dinner party tonight. I suppose this one downside of technology upgrades.

column1: Update: After 20 minutes on hold
column2: I spoke with customer service. Went through all of the troubleshooting issues that were on the website. Didn’t solve problem. Apparently it is a hardware issue and I need to get a new modem for my Sonos system to update and function properly. It is what it is - the price of technology. My customer rep was really smart and patient
column3: so I changed my review from 2 stars to 3 stars.";"2018-03-13T22:53:59-07:00";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/review?id=293523031&type=Purple%20Software";"293523031";161;"en";"POSITIVE"

column1: 47;1852671748;"TonyLaCT";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/reviews/id13007435";"8.0";5;"Mystifying changes to a good app";"Great product
column2: but The latest app made bad changes to the interface for rooms management.  It seems to be oriented to playing the same thing in multiple rooms but the implementation makes individual room control a gigantic pain.  To switch rooms you have to uncheck one room and check the other. Oh
column3: and If you flick The tab down rather than hitting “Done” start over.  You will think unchecking a room  turns off the music. It doesn’t.  That may be ok
column4: but I was so confused I wasn’t sure. Then there is this bug: In my case when unchecking dining room and checking family room (which I wanted to turn off)
column5: after hitting “Done”   it kept going back to Dining room which happens to be he first name in the list. The only way I could turn off the music in the Family room was grouping both rooms and hitting off. I would trash this whole concept.  Roll it back one version guys and forget this.";"2017-10-16T05:16:43-07:00";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/review?id=293523031&type=Purple%20Software";"293523031";166;"en";"NEGATIVE"

column1: 48;2715175439;"JG in SB";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/reviews/id232505361";"8.6";4;"V 8.6 Crashes Constantly on iPhone X";"Just like the review title says.  Crashes constantly on the iPhone X.  Usually after browsing songs in Apple Music.

Also it STILL doesn’t work to retune speakers with TruePlay using the iPhone X and also the iPhone 8 from what I have read.  Both phones have been out for over six months.  Oh yeah and the icing on the cake is that you won’t learn that TruePlay doesn’t work on your iPhone X until you have completed the entire process and it freezes indefinitely on the last step.  Since SONOS knows this doesn’t work (I learned about it when I tried to find info in their forums...and there is info about this) it would be kind of nice if they popped up a warning at the START of the process to let you know you can’t do it on your particular hardware.

So why do I still rate this app a 4?  Because overall it is still an awesome app.  I’m optimistic SONOS will fix these issues (hopefully soon) but in the meantime you should be aware of them.";"2018-06-17T19:04:28-07:00";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/review?id=293523031&type=Purple%20Software";"293523031";179;"en";"POSITIVE"
49;4760402444;"Momoftwoladies";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/reviews/id29298763";"10.4";2;"Latest update not great";"Love the speakers
column2: love controlling them with the app. Now the bad. The latest update made it more cumbersome. Why oh why did you move the alarm control in the latest update?!?! The former tab “more” on the far right made so much more sense than “settings” because there’s a lot more than settings under it (pun intended). Now to find the alarm function you have to go to settings->system-> and scroll way down to alarms. For someone that uses 2 of these speakers as morning alarms for my kids and frequently turns the alarms on or off and makes adjustments this is SUCH A HASSLE. After the update I struggled to find the alarm in the first place because it’s so NOT intuitive. Initially I thought the alarm control was deleted.

column1: The Alarm control is a major feature for many people using these speakers and it should be in an intuitive and convenient location. Please move the Alarm control back to an easily accessed place that doesn’t require several taps and scrolling down to find it! And IMO “More” as a menu title was more accurate of a descriptor and way better sounding than “Settings”.";"2019-09-11T02:43:42-07:00";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/review?id=293523031&type=Purple%20Software";"293523031";196;"en";"NEGATIVE"

50;4253829117;"WeHo Eddie";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/reviews/id180379471";"10.2.1";5;"Fantastic When It Works Prooerly";"Overall I love the Sonos wireless speaker system and app controller. Sound quality is very good. If you’re a person that buys or used to buy wired speakers to listen to your music you will not find Sonos to have that same quality
column2: but Sonosis very good. My opinion is almost every size room needs at least a Sonos three if not a Sonos five. And by all means get a pair for each room unless the room is really small. The stereo separation and sound quality is so much better.

column1: What keeps me from giving a five out of five rating is there still are several bugs that occur weekly. Music will stop at random times
column2: speakers will ungroup
column3: and music will stop mid-song and start randomly sampling several songs before settling down and playing one all the way through.  Despite these flaws
column4: the app is easy to use
column5: speakers are easy to add and controlling music is easy through the app.";"2019-06-02T14:22:05-07:00";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/review?id=293523031&type=Purple%20Software";"293523031";163;"en";"POSITIVE"

column1: 51;1836371358;"Audio Vision";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/reviews/id31831510";"8.0";1;"Worst upgrade!";"I run a professional AV company

column10: IMHO
column11: the new white background is more than just a subjective complaint. It eats battery life
column12: and is so much less pleasant when using the controller in reduced lighting situations. Hate it.

column1: 60;2966843175;"Spiked jones";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/reviews/id214883138";"9.0";4;"SONOS";"In general
column2: this innovative system has transformed our home. We have had Sonos since it was introduced to the market. It has developed into an easy to use sound delivery system providing our home with music
column3: news and podcasts with smart phone and computer app controls that are easy to use.  The sound is quite good and its several autonomous modular options allow flexibility of delivery.  Stereo is readily achievable by pairing modular units.

column1: Occasional software updates can slow things up a bit.  At times the system seems to forget where it is and asks me to start from scratch. I don’t like passwords and find it unnecessary for something like Sonos.  I know the trend will be to have AI invading our homes so I hope Sonos has an opt out feature to allow those of us not interested in being spied on to have a simple server in the house and have to endure the vagaries of AI second guessing our every decision regarding the simplest of pleasures.";"2018-07-25T05:11:32-07:00";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/review?id=293523031&type=Purple%20Software";"293523031";170;"en";"POSITIVE"

column1: 83;1980846442;"The Ghost of Common Sense Past";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/reviews/id673413820";"8.2.1";4;"Sonos: Great hardware but software progressively gets worse.";"I currently have 10 Sonos speakers/playbar/sub.  Phenomenal system!  For some odd reason

column1: 84;1951372610;"Pr0digy411";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/reviews/id258275908";"8.2.1";1;"New add speaker won’t connect cause loss of whole system.";"I’ve had a Sonos Playbar
column2: Sub
column3: and Bridge since they first came out. When those were purchased I had some minor issues getting my Playbar to sync w the Bridge and my WiFi. A few year go by and now that Sonos came out with Sonos One smart speaker I decided to give it a go for my bedroom. Simply put the new speaker would not connect to my existing setup I have followed every step possible that I could research online some of them ridiculous on the steps they want you to take to attempt to connect a WiFi speaker. In the end I thought possibly my Bridge(no longer produced was the issue) and in an attempt to take signal strength out of the equation I went and purchased a new Boost unit. I wiped my entire system and started from scratch even to the extend of uninstalling the app and re installing it. Boost is found ok good to go. Well no I still cannot connect any of my speakers. This systems went from decent to utter crap in a few years. I dunno how Sonos claims easy setup. Nothing but headaches!";"2017-11-26T15:52:47-07:00";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/review?id=293523031&type=Purple%20Software";"293523031";194;"en";"POSITIVE"

column1: 86;5692884125;"Stock photog";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/reviews/id154225422";"11.0";1;"Disappointed";"I’ve had Sonos for about a year. The app has had issues from day one and has only gotten worse. Before anyone asks
column2: yes phone is up to date and the app is up to date. The router is about 15’ away and signal is strong.

column1: So it started with occasional need to restart to where I am now that it just shuts down. Sometimes it keeps playing music and I can’t turn it off with the app I have to go the speaker to shut it down. At this point any time I open the app it’s an issue. Either it can’t connect and needs to be restarted or it will start to play and if the phone closes I’ll have to close the app out and restart it. I’m getting the white screen of death when I open the app. It just sits there and says can’t connect.

The speaker is great but the app is why I have stopped buying Sonos which I had planned to do the TV sound bar and additional speakers throughout the house. For the money of the Play 5 forget it. Others are more reliable and going back to Bluetooth.";"2020-03-21T10:52:37-07:00";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/review?id=293523031&type=Purple%20Software";"293523031";198;"en";"POSITIVE"

87;3947616034;"high quality when it works";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/reviews/id18352751";"10.0.3";2;"Nightmare if 2 diff systems on same WIFI";"I’ve had 2 Play5’s for about a year now.   When I can get them to work
column2: I think they are the best quality sound of any speakers I’ve ever owned.  The problem is that it is extremely hard to listen to music with them.  I am a renter in a multi-unit house
column3: using the same Wifi network as my neighbor/landlord.  We both own Sonos and have the systems segregated with different email login.  Its a nightmare to connect to my system.  It ALWAYS auto-connects to the wrong system and about 60-70% of days that I go through the hassle of trying to sign into my account and connect to the correct speakers it just doesn't work.  Its like the controller app forgets about systems it was connected to and stops displaying them for weeks at a time.  The step where you pair device with a temporary wifi network for the phone to connect to
column4: also never works.  For the price of these hardware
column5: the lack of quality and reliability with the smartphone app is fraud.";"2019-03-30T11:22:02-07:00";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/review?id=293523031&type=Purple%20Software";"293523031";175;"en";"NEGATIVE"

column1: 88;3798633764;"Drippin25";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/reviews/id144518367";"10.0.1";1;"Fix the skip issue";"My roommate uses the Sonos app and has been complaining about it skipping songs for months now. I downloaded it and tried it out and as soon as I would lock my phone songs would be skipped 30 seconds later. Every song
column2: there are no full songs that play when the phone is locked. I looked the issue up and I saw this has been a problem for 6+ months now. This is absolutely unacceptable for a device that requires an app to play and does not allow Bluetooth. It is a shame because the device itself is hands down one of the best I’ve used in terms of quality
column3: but is rendered useless because the app refuses to play a full song. To be quite truthful Sonos should be embarrassed because this has been a known issue for over 6 months and dev team have still not fixed it. It’s not like it’s something they can let slide
column4: it’s very blatant that many people are experiencing issues. If roku’s app had an issue where videos were being skipped the problem would be addressed and fixed in days";"2019-02-21T16:29:07-07:00";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/review?id=293523031&type=Purple%20Software";"293523031";188;"en";"NEGATIVE"

column1: 89;2215210748;"Jamin' Grammy";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/reviews/id33035854";"8.3.1";3;"Sonos Used to be great";"We have had several Sonos units in our home for years and enjoyed them quite a lot.  Also recommended them to family and friends.  However

column1: Update to my review: We moved the Sonos/Alexa unit to a room closer to our WiFi router.  The signal is much improved and so is the reliability of the connection.  However

We must use the buttons on the top of the unit to control the volume.  Very annoying!";"2018-02-16T09:23:46-07:00";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/review?id=293523031&type=Purple%20Software";"293523031";168;"en";"POSITIVE"

column1: 97;3581164337;"17 monthUser";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/reviews/id400382751";"9.3.1";2;"High Quality Audio - Horrible Update Again!!";"After 6 years of owning my Sonos I am still amazed that this company would shut down my Sonos Connect until I downloaded their flawed update.  This is the third time I’ve been aggravated by their flawed update and if I had just purchased this product I would be returning it immediately.

I always prefer to update my devices once the “bugs are worked out”.   Why would Sonos even put out an update without extensive testing and reviewing periods?   It speaks to their foolishness or maybe a sense of urgency to collect and sell customer’s personal information.  Why else would Sonos need to access your cellular data for a unit that is hard wired at your home (and not mobile).

When I purchased my Sonos it played Pandora commercials just once every few hours.  Their updates changed that benefit too.  There are better choices for streaming at home and I will not ever again recommend a Sonos anyone.";"2018-12-27T13:44:36-07:00";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/review?id=293523031&type=Purple%20Software";"293523031";158;"en";"NEGATIVE"

column2: beyond unacceptable";"I am finding myself calling Sonos customer service for the third time since I’ve installed my latest product
column3: which sadly was only Christmas. Six weeks ago. Reliability is abysmal. Some specifics… The system used to be able to play from airplay
column4: no more. Connect-drop. Connect-drop. Another example… It won’t go seamlessly between my surroundsound for the TV and playing music. I spent $700 on this playbar and then learned that I have to reconfigure the system in order to go between surround sound on the TV and stereo music. If I had known I had to pick between stereo music and surround sound for TV in the same room I never would’ve spent the money!!! Third issue... they tell you that they will play from the iPhone music library? They don’t tell you that they truncate my music list. I have about 25% of my music library available within Sonos app. Random missing music. WHY???? If I could just access my music library I wouldn’t have to worry about the Airplay issues. DON’T BUY THIS PRODUCT.";"2019-02-11T06:54:00-07:00";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/review?id=293523031&type=Purple%20Software";"293523031";176;"en";"NEGATIVE"

103;1922338966;"Ed Baxter";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/reviews/id128898945";"8.2";2;"Still no dark mode option?!";"I’ve been a Sonos customer for years. Their apps have always been easy to use

column3: and attractive to look at. The last major overhaul turned the app into a difficult to use and overall annoying experience. What used to take just a few simple taps is now confusing and awkward. Gone is ability to change the background to a dark mode/theme. column1: Sonos used to be innovative and trendsetting. With their latest app they seem to be following the trends of other music service apps that are also difficult and complicated to use. column1: 104;6273042156;"Kmichl";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/reviews/id116372632";"11.2.2";1;"Update crashed my system";"I had a special event 2 days ago  for a few friends and wasn't able to play a Sonos Favorite Playlist that I had laboriously worked on. Yesterday I decided to remove all my legacy Play:5 speakers and to use the Sonos S2 Controller app with the Play:3 speakers and a Playbar.  Everything worked great. column1: 106;2047449249;"Orlandog1";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/reviews/id41986765";"8.2.2";4;"Greg. Sonos fanatic";"I think the Sonos System and hardware is outstanding. column2: I’m sure audiophiles may find the sound not up to their expectations . My ear is not that tuned and therefore it is not a concern for me. Certainly the ability to stream almost any song ever recorded makes up for any inefficiencies the system may have at this time. Having said that
column3: the biggest issue I have with Sonos is in the mobile app. This most recent update I think is a  step backward

column1: Thanks a million for such a creative application!!

Now... let’s address the sound! Wow! I can’t believe the amazing audio system I have in my home now. When I thought Bose had it wrapped up outcomes Sonos and steals the show. 113;5188784543;"Serg.O";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/reviews/id118780476";"10.5.1";1;"Play 3 Sonos speakers";"The speakers are ok but they are not a true WiFi speaker. Sonos is more interested on providing a music service via their APP. They continuously update their firmware and APP interface to keep up with the latest computer and mobile technology. It all sounds good huh...

Well here is the problem. Early Sonos customers will eventually not be able to play their music from their favorite playlist or Steaming service of its not entered into an agreement with Sonos to be on their APP. Thus eventually you will end up being phased out and thus your speakers will be obsolete and of no use to you. Unless of course if you go and purchase new hardware to keep up with their firmware updates they force you to download to your device.  Every time you end up downloading a update you are gambling that your device will be able to handle it.  If not you are SOL
They are more interested in you buying the speakers to have you locked into their Sonos APP service
column2: where think they are Making their money.

column1: A true WiFi speaker will allow you to play your music from any computer or mobile device
column2: regardless of how old your WiFi  operating and hardware systems are.

column1: Bottom line they are a WiFi music service and not a true WiFi speaker company that will allow you to steam music from any steaming app or music you have already purchased.";"2019-11-23T15:27:26-07:00";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/review?id=293523031&type=Purple%20Software";"293523031";242;"en";"POSITIVE"

I used to do in my own home and had multiple speaker switch boxes to accommodate the number of speakers I had.

I have 14 Sonos speakers throughout my home and they work impeccably. Surround sound on the TV with the Sound Bar and Subwoofer is dynamic and I can listen anywhere In the house if I don’t feel like staying on the couch.  Everyone can listen to a different station or playlist in any room. It’s great for guests to choose their own music to fit their mood at any time.

My only request is that Sonos start adding input jacks to the Sonos PlayOne and PlayThree. It just makes sense.";"2019-01-31T05:35:47-07:00";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/review?id=293523031&type=Purple%20Software";"293523031";143;"en";"POSITIVE"

column2: fundamental feature of any music player app that the fact that they’d even entertain the idea of removing it is laughable. Sure you can still stream music from Apple/Amazon/Spotify or your computer
column3: but you shouldn’t be limited to those options. It would be extremely inconvenient to lose this functionality.

column2: iPad
column3: or iPod Touch' feature in 2012 as an option to play locally stored audio content on Sonos. The way this feature was originally architected has become unreliable with newer versions of iOS.

column4: paint-by-numbers setup helped the medicine go down that much easier.

column1: After hearing the first one
column2: we doubled the dose for double the pleasure ... in stereo. Couldn’t order the second Sonos One fast enough.  The system ties to all our devices
column3: including Apple TV
column4: and connects to a slew of content.

column1: We have a 10 year old
column2: 40” Samsung flatscreen
column3: and adding stereo sound with this level of fidelity made for nothing less than a transformative moment. Stunning sound with even highs and heavy distortion-free bass. The Sonos One represents our first foray into the world of Alexa. And so far
column4: so good. Ripping our old Samsung sound bar off the wall never felt so good.

column1: Crystal clear WiFi stereo - that streams as smoothly as it sounds - is just the therapy our tired ears needed. column1: 188;2465063998;"Theft By Deception";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/reviews/id490648734";"8.5.1";1;"Skips and Stops - Wasted $3800";"Whether playing from WiFi or directly through an aux cable into the five it skips through every song and after a few songs it stops. The Aleksa app has very limited functionality and is really misrepresented. The help desk simply says well it doesn’t do those capabilities. Well then it’s not Aleksa.

As far as the help line they open a case and close it in two days if they don’t hear back. They should realize if someone spends $3800 on their system perhaps they’re busy and can’t reply that quickly.

column1: 207;6937356025;"Simon Gaviotas";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/reviews/id377590379";"11.2.4";2;"Frustrating update after frustrating update";"I’ve been waiting for years to write this. Bottom line

column1: It’s asking me to use an Ethernet cable to- no. Stop.
Don’t buy Sonos. Don’t use Sonos. After this I’m going back to wired. Not worthy he hassle.
I’m using a play at and the S1 app. Music and breakfast has turned into a half hour of trouble shooting.

Nothing is worth this much hassle. I’m done with Sonos forever. Just glad I had this revelation before my friend considered purchasing a Sonos system and talked them out of it. He now has a wired set up and guess what? It’s works when he wants it to. column1: 209;3750955549;"JMM00";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/reviews/id104026780";"10.0";1;"Waste of Money.";"I recently spent thousands of dollars updating my speaker system to the new Sonos speakers with airplay capability only to find that the Airplay doesn’t work most of the time. 210;3467552837;"Ryanisheartless";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/reviews/id105694709";"9.2";3;"Love SONOS
column2: but the app needs work.";"So let me say that I love my SONOS system and wouldn’t trade it for anything. This app
column3: however has some issues that have been ongoing and need to be resolved.

column1: First: Apple Music Playlists

Only playlists that I have created myself are accessible via the sonos app. The Apple Music curated personal mixes are not able to be accessed and an error happens any time I try to load them no matter which way I navigate to them within the app.
Second: when scrolling through the artists view within the Apple Music section
column2: there used to be the sidebar to the right with the alphabet that could be used to quickly jump to a certain letter in the alphabet. That has been gone for some time now and makes it extremely inconvenient to find a particular artist when you have a huge Apple Music library like I do.

column1: Last: controls for toggling repeat/repeat all/shuffle should be directly on the play screen. An extra menu just to get to those is completely unnecessary.
I thank you again for building an amazing product
column2: and I look forward to seeing what future releases hold for both hardware and software!";"2018-11-27T14:01:11-07:00";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/review?id=293523031&type=Purple%20Software";"293523031";197;"en";"POSITIVE"

column1: 211;2633316911;"bhaven0t";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/reviews/id329831294";"8.5.2";4;"Mostly awesome !";"I’ve had Sonos for over 10 years and unsure about continuing. Great sound quality

I understand the refusal to use Bluetooth but at the prices you guys charge for speakers maybe you can throw some more money to R&D and develop a way that will keep me as a customer longer. column1: 212;1994211935;"Mjababababab";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/reviews/id147238480";"8.2.2";3;"Latest update is confusing";"The App can’t tell the difference between an iOS app update vs firmware. And then the  queue/library selector is confusing. Hidden behind door number 3 or is it 4?   Slide down. Nope that’s now playing. Slide down from other screen. Ah. there it is.  If there’s a button or obvious way I can’t find it. It’s like a video game..I click and swipe in different places to see what’ll happen.  This is called  Low discovery.

And don’t get me started on the new requirement to have a Sonos account!  I just want to play my music. Entering passwords?  Great another place to have my info stolen from.";"2017-12-13T14:36:28-07:00";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/review?id=293523031&type=Purple%20Software";"293523031";143;"en";"POSITIVE"

column2: but about 25% of the time I get caught I an update
column3: or a doesn’t immediately recognize system
column4: or something that takes me 10 minutes to navigate before listening. In fact it just happened where it did a system update
column5: asked for email (again)
column6: had me set-up password (again). Since it took multiple times we’re talking about 10-15 minutes til I’m listening to anything. It always seems to be when it’s the most inconvenient- people come over
column7: etc.  This might not seem so annoying if I used everyday so the frequency rate seemed less.

column1: So... I would still recommend trying the system if you are a frequent user
column2: but for my situation I wish I just invested in a good Bluetooth set-up.";"2018-07-14T11:24:56-07:00";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/review?id=293523031&type=Purple%20Software";"293523031";198;"en";"POSITIVE"

column1: 225;1880809788;"Just Hanging___";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/reviews/id19307015";"8.1";1;"Great system
column2: terrible UI update";"I’ve been a Sonos user for ten years
column3: so I clearly love the system. It seems that the good reviews are from new users and about the quality of the speakers. The speakers are fantastic and if you haven’t been a long time user
column4: you might not realize that this update is a real step back for the UI of Sonos.

column1: The new workflows for getting anything done are very unintuitive and less efficient than they used to be.
To give a user case
column2: consider putting music on in Bedroom while you are listening to music in Living Room. You need at least 5 touches!

column1: - tap the disclosure triangle on the Now playing screen to reveal the lower menu bar
- tap Rooms in the menu bar
- tap Bedroom
- tap Browse or My Sonos in the menu bar
- select your music
column2: which will take at least one tap

column1: This kind of workflow was effortless in the old app taking just a few taps.

This is just one example; other longtime users have written about other issues with the new app. I hope Sonos reads these reviews and reassesses the decisions they have made in order to regain the simplicity and efficiency of the old version.
As for me
column2: I’ll be going through the rather extreme step of rolling back my iPhone backup to get back to the old version of Sonos.";"2017-10-28T05:05:36-07:00";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/review?id=293523031&type=Purple%20Software";"293523031";235;"en";"POSITIVE"

column1: 260;2154521439;"turbulence19";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/reviews/id22709966";"8.3.1";4;"Update issue";"When updating to 8.3.1 the app asks me to open Sonos in the App Store to get the update

column3: which loops me back to the app
column4: which of course asks me to open Sonos in the App Store in order to update...

column1: Follow up review: Sonos responded to this review within a day with a suggested fix. When I opened my Sonos app to try out the fix
column2: the update had mysteriously and automatically occurred and all was well. So while I still don’t know what the problem was
column3: it all worked out. The point of this follow up is to note that the company was responsive to my issue
column4: so I’m happy to upgrade the review rating.";"2018-02-01T10:37:20-07:00";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/review?id=293523031&type=Purple%20Software";"293523031";134;"en";"POSITIVE"

column1: 261;2012229431;"macaddiict";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/reviews/id39220609";"8.2.2";5;"New to Sonos - loving it!";"We recently installed a 5-speaker Sonos system using Sonos One speakers in different rooms. We are pleased with the quality of the sound

column2: getting out of sync with each other
column3: and being slow to respond. I wasn’t sure what to expect from Sonos

column5: 000. With Sonos

column1: Sonos now supports almost every premium music service and Internet Radio. Add a Sonos Connect and you can add any legacy component like a tuner or turntable and instantly they join the system.
Sonos is more than slightly over priced on their speakers. But you have to hear the Play 5 to believe how much quality comes from a small modern Sonos speaker.

My change  from 70s components to Sonos was a sound move. My only complaint is the lack of an ability to stream from my Sonos Network to my iPhone then I could listen to Sonos library via my Bose headphones while working in the yard.";"2017-12-16T16:51:04-07:00";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/review?id=293523031&type=Purple%20Software";"293523031";172;"en";"POSITIVE"

This is made even more annoying by the fact that 100% of the time

column6: the app has skipped ahead - usually by several tracks - instead of resuming from the point at which comms was momentarily lost. This is simply unacceptable and infuriating. I spent my entire career as a software engineer and can’t imagine why sane behavior would be impossible.

column1: The only response I’ve gotten from Sonos support thus far is to request that I submit diagnostics when this happens. But my issue is not that comms is lost
column2: it’s what the app does in response.";"2018-06-10T07:17:37-07:00";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/review?id=293523031&type=Purple%20Software";"293523031";131;"en";"NEGATIVE"

column1: 287;3873803991;"overandunder";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/reviews/id30593046";"10.0.3";1;"Major disappointment to loyal customer";"I have two systems and recommended another to a family member. The issues is below in italics and the fix is not a real fix.
iOS devices which causes audio interruptions when you have non-Sonos AirPlay devices on your network and your iOS device goes to sleep. We're investigating the issue
column2: but for now you can get the streaming going again by disabling AirPlay on any non-Sonos devices in your home
column3: or by disabling auto lock in your iOS device's settings menu under display & brightness. Another option is to sync your phone's storage with a computer
column4: and stream from a music share.

column1: This is absolutely terrible
column2: an important customer is currently suffering because they are an Apple household
column3: music being streamed from an iPhone was randomly stopping in the middle of a track and skipping to the next track during a party - Very embarrassing for our client. This problem never existed before

column1: WHAT IS GOING ON SONOS !? - BY NOW THIS PROBLEM SHOULD HAVE BEEN RESOLVED !

How do you expect people to switch-off auto-lock on their iPhones when it compromises privacy ? column1: 289;5791575899;"I need a nickname that's not taken";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/reviews/id34953941";"11.0";4;"Please add Apple Watch functionality";"I’ve been a Sonos fan for years. Ease of use and great sound quality are the reasons I have expanded my Sonos setup over the years
Two things I would love to see in the future (though one seems easier than the other):

Please add Apple Watch functionality. It would be helpful to play the Next track while working out in my home gym (where my phone isn’t necessarily handy) or adjust the volume on the Sonos Bar while watching TV. If one or two touches could give me access to the most important functions
column2: it would really enhance the overall experience.

column1: The other request is more complicated. I would LOVE it if Sonos integrated a mesh network into its speakers similar to Google Nest. That would encourage me to further expand my Sonos network and I wouldn’t need to have to have two systems. If the Sonos One could simultaneously play great music and extend my wifi network
column2: I would have one in every room of my house.";"2020-04-10T08:27:49-07:00";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/review?id=293523031&type=Purple%20Software";"293523031";169;"en";"POSITIVE"

column1: 290;1952784250;"Tesla&Edison";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/reviews/id225484172";"8.2.1";5;"Best Music Purchase Ever";"I always have music playing in the background and until we discovered Sonos
column2: that meant we had to have a radio or CD player in every room. Now we have placed Sonos speakers in every room including the patio and pool house and we can wander from place to place without losing the sound. If we don’t want music in a particular area we can shut it off for that room simply by using the Sonos app and unchecking that room. If I want music and he wants sports we can direct different options to different speakers. Sonos has made easier and the sound quality is excellent.";"2017-11-27T06:31:01-07:00";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/review?id=293523031&type=Purple%20Software";"293523031";107;"en";"POSITIVE"

column1: 292;2002119093;"Exavior";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/reviews/id12656954";"8.2.2";1;"A good start but full of bugs";"Why is it that when I set a zone to play a shuffled playlist
column2: every day when I return to play that zone it starts over at the first track?  It should remember where it left off.

column1: I’m also not a fan of queue based shuffling... why not just have it pick a random track every time rather than making users hit a shuffle button and wait for a 3000+ tack playlist to SLOWLY randomize.  Picking a random number after each track finishes is much faster and would prevent the issue where returning to a “random” playlist has the same tracks in the same order every time
column2: and always starts at track 1 rather than where you left off.

column1: This player is a HORRIBLE user experience.  And based on how slow your company moves I’m sure it’ll not be address for 3 or 4 years....";"2017-12-16T15:04:32-07:00";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/review?id=293523031&type=Purple%20Software";"293523031";145;"en";"POSITIVE"

293;2020252673;"Crocboy49";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/reviews/id20221474";"8.2.2";5;"What an awesome system!";"We recently right-sized and replaced our stereo/home theatre systems throughout our house with a Sonos system. I am thoroughly pleased with how well the system works

column1: UPDATE  We still love our Sonos System
