column1: 294;4370269743;"Wings West";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/reviews/id800062518";"10.2.3";4;"Pretty good";"I use the app these days mostly for streaming SiriusXM radio.
The app works reliably when it comes to playing music from this service. That is
column2: except for displaying the correct artist and song/album name
column3: where that information is often out of sync with the music
column4: sometimes displaying information from a song played several prior to the one actually being played.

column1: This same problem occurs on three different recent vintage iPhones we have in our family
column2: as well as a Samsung tablet
column3: which tells me the issue may not be with the app. But
column4: nonetheless
column5: it needs to be addressed.

column1: The app works very well for controlling our Sonos equipment. It does have some shortcomings
column2: though. For instance
column3: it lacks any controls to pause
column4: skip backward/forward. The SiriusXM app for the iPad/iPhone does have these controls
column5: but the app can only be used for playing music on that device.

column1: For these reasons
column2: I took away 1 star from an otherwise very good app. I would definitely recommend this app.";"2019-06-25T19:55:07-07:00";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/review?id=293523031&type=Purple%20Software";"293523031";169;"en";"POSITIVE"

column1: 295;2913384370;"SilverSideDown";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/reviews/id36809095";"9.0";4;"Iterating on wrong features";"I'm reducing the testing to 2 stars so that maybe devs see it. I post in user forums

column1: I hate the refresh of the home screen on each load because the app is too stupid to cache the ""most recent"" albums it just fetched a second ago. column1: 296;2676311487;"Frustrated Seattle";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/reviews/id108646449";"8.5.2";3;"Sonos - more like so-so";"Sound is VERY lack luster for what I paid.  Wireless is a nice idea

column1: 297;2408011457;"joiemcclements";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/reviews/id32012536";"8.4";3;"New software is driving me crazy!!";"I wrote the review below a year ago. Then I rated Sonos 5 stars. I still love Sonos
column2: but the new software is quirky. I often can’t choose a new station or play in two different rooms like I used to. Fix the software and it’ll go back up to 5 stars.

column1: We started with the wireless network a stereo and a mono player. We just added 2 more players. They're practically effortless to set up
column2: controlled from phone
column3: iPad
column4: computer
column5: can group the units or play different things on every player. The sound is rich

column7: usually from our iPhones effortlessly. We're hoping to add a couple more speakers this year.";"2018-04-10T19:31:22-07:00";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/review?id=293523031&type=Purple%20Software";"293523031";127;"en";"POSITIVE"

column1: 298;2398558382;"Kappatvating";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/reviews/id31777281";"8.4";4;"Could be better";"I was very hopeful with this MAJOR investment but I’m a bit disappointed in the functionality of this app.
I purchased 2 sonos one’s a play bar and subwoofer. There are times with the sound that it will only play on the play bar even though I previously set it for surround sound.
The app routinely seems to have a delay between when I click the room for surround sound and actual sound coming on. (The delay is very slight but a delay nonetheless).

I called sonos customer service and they said the going in and out is due to a different MH’s used when it serves as a surround sound vice grouping. In essence what I purchased the system for with matching play ones (because you can not do surround sound without matching speakers) is an either or choice.

Either forsake the ability to play different music in different rooms on different speakers or use my system as a surround sound and not play different music on different speakers without each time disconnecting and reconnecting as a group";"2018-04-08T07:52:55-07:00";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/review?id=293523031&type=Purple%20Software";"293523031";179;"en";"POSITIVE"
299;6071609181;"ingernet";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/reviews/id19486852";"11.2";1;"Great hardware; the software is WRETCHED";"If I could find a third-party software to use to connect to my speakers

I have gone so far as to factory reset the speakers and try to reconnect them to my network that way. They won’t authenticate

column1: 302;3082938949;"kansasboy";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/reviews/id38066226";"9.0";2;"Good not great";"I recently moved into a new house.  Decided to NOT wire up my old system that ran great. Internet issues / cutting in and out at times / not playing specific songs from your iTunes library or only playin 60 seconds of a song then skipping to the next song. Very frustrating. column1: 303;1913756280;"snicker_dude_l";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/reviews/id24551365";"8.1";3;"New Update not intuitive";"While the new update has solved some of the connectivity issues of its predecessor; however

There really needs to be a mode where it freezes everything in time and you can use it from there in like a non connected device. It’s like the Xbox vs old Nitendo. Remember the 8 bit Nintendo? column1: 306;5515858466;"E.P.Global";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/reviews/id35632321";"10.6.2";3;"Changes limit performance";"I’ve been using sonos for over 5 years in 3 different homes. I was an avid supporter
column2: and even bought shares when they went public. This shows how much I’ve enjoyed their products and services in the past. That’s changing now.

column1: Sonos’ lack of ability to support legacy devices is a concern both economically and enviornmentally. That’s well reported on the internet. Who wants to invest in expensive speakers that become obsolete in a few years with no major performance upgrades”

The other big problem I have with Sonos is that they no longer allow you to play specific media from the controlling device. One of the great pleasures I enjoyed was having friends play music from THEIR phones when they visited. It is also a real pain to have to stream content when you are in a remote area with limited access.
Still good products and an ok experience other than the points mentioned above. BTW I sold my shares- can buy them back header  if the company gets its act together.
E.P.";"2020-02-10T23:31:03-07:00";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/review?id=293523031&type=Purple%20Software";"293523031";174;"en";"POSITIVE"

307;3710654257;"CptKirk48";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/reviews/id24112212";"10.0";3;"Problems Problems Problems";"Sonos worked for years with my older Play 5’s and several iPods and iPhones. Then the dreaded track skipping and loss of connections started. By uninstalling Sonos software then powering down/restarting the device and reinstalling Sonos I could usually get thing running again. Rebooting my router was sometimes a help.

About a year ago went through several submissions with Sonos tech support. They helped once by pointing out that the router and Sonos must be on different channels. Several times the tech support tried to tell me there were issues with AC power lines in the walls near the speakers. And other electronic devices nearby - none were close. And remember things worked fine for years. And work fine after software updates.
Biggest help was when Sonos releases updated software. Can usually tell an update is coming when problems start again and are not fixable.
Last two tech support requests and build diagnostics were simply ignored.
Great and enjoyable system when it works. Lousy when it does not.";"2019-01-29T18:22:44-07:00";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/review?id=293523031&type=Purple%20Software";"293523031";168;"en";"POSITIVE"

column1: 309;3143162878;"NickRider";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/reviews/id43163403";"9.0";5;"Speakers are good... App is terrible.";"This app is incredibly glitchy and unstable. It will just randomly not find my music

column1: 316;6053188776;"wildcatwags";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/reviews/id39403995";"11.2";1;"Betrayed loyal Sonos fans";"I’m not one to leave reviews but something had to be said with this new app and the direction Sonos is taking. column1: I was going to upgrade my Playbar to the ARC but not anymore. column2: the wording under the app is too long and is crammed together. All they needed to do is name it Sonos S1 and keep the app icon black and bold.

column1: As far as future updates.... I understand technology becomes obsolete but saying anything after May 2020 is obsolete is a JOKE!!!! Heck at least Apple iPhones receive updates on 5 year old devices.

column1: Previous review: Love it!

318;5201028712;"WazzaMartin";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/reviews/id22184750";"10.5.2";1;"Terrible system";"Have had the system for years and I barley use it anymore because it is nonstop troubles. They no longer allow you to wirelessly play music off your own phone which is ridiculous. You can try to go line in but that means your phone has to be stationary by a speaker and then again we found that it won’t broadcast to all speakers. The system generally seems to work with steaming services with the issue of speakers still not being able to be found.";"2019-11-26T14:33:07-07:00";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/review?id=293523031&type=Purple%20Software";"293523031";136;"en";"NEGATIVE"

column1: 321;3383070119;"orvalle";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/reviews/id4809253";"9.2";5;"Crashes on return to app";"Sonos is a great system for playback. The app could use more work though.

Another annoyance I face is the tedious 5-10 second modal dialog delay to tell me the number of tracks added to the queue. I like to queue up an artist’s albums from my library. A different

column2: Buggy";"I run the Sonos controller between mobile and desktop on two networks. While the mobile app is by far the better of the two apps they do not play well together.

column3: pause
column4: etc

323;2065592462;"jnich sonos";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/reviews/id46276927";"8.2.2";3;"Mixed - old interface great. New interface stinks. I mean stinks awful. Fire the developer";"I’ve had the sonos system throughout our home for 2 years. I love the sound quality.

I loved the old interface in the iPhone and iPad which was very easy to use and made so much sense. Even my 70 year old parents were wowed how easy to use. I used to recommend sonos all the time. 5 stars for old system.

I just downloaded the new interface. The NEW interface is AWFUL compared to the old. More steps to do the same thing. Less intuitive. Can’t jump between rooms as easily. Many times it won’t add or drop a room until the second or third try now.  Can’t find favorites as easily.  They must be banking on people interacting w Alexis Voice interface. Two thumbs down and rework it. 1 star for this. I would literally fire the team that developed this. I would not recommend to anyone until fixed. This is how a company loses market share quickly.

Please offer old UI. I would back track to it if I could.  I would add to the 6 sonos speakers I own.";"2018-01-07T03:29:47-07:00";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/review?id=293523031&type=Purple%20Software";"293523031";183;"en";"POSITIVE"

column1: 395;1951959110;"MobileDaemon";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/reviews/id22752237";"8.2.1";1;"Love my sonos
column2: hate this app";"I have had my sonos system for years and love it
column3: but the app has continually gotten worse. I've built software for 25 years and this one is one of the worst from a UX perspective. It's a pretty app but it doesn't prioritize the most common functions and make them the easiest to perform. You have to switch screens for simple actions. Frequently what's playing is hard to find. Switching between rooms and changing what's playing takes too many unintuitive steps. If you are on the UX team I suggest you do new user testing. Just put people in front of the app and watch them struggle to do perform the most common actions in a house with more than one speaker. I won't be getting rid of my sonos because of this app but I hope this review makes a positive impact.";"2017-11-26T21:44:14-07:00";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/review?id=293523031&type=Purple%20Software";"293523031";144;"en";"POSITIVE"

column1: 427;1938548596;"Over it ....";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/reviews/id26523263";"8.2.1";2;"App is terrible
column2: speakers sound great";"User interface for the Sonos app was never good
column3: but recently (around Aug/Sep 2017) it was updated and became even more counter intuitive than before and I didn’t think that was even possible.

column1: The speakers are great and the multi-room synchronization is the best in the business but this new app’s UI is horrible.

Searching for things in Apple Music is extremely difficult unless you know the exact song name spelling (can’t type “drinking” if title is “drinkin’”) and you have to know what album songs are on if you only know the artist which makes it extremely cumbersome to find any song by artist.  Overall searching for Apple music content is just plain difficult in Sonos app and easier to search in Apple Music app then copy exact song name spelling to Sonos app.
Apple Music functionality has always been terrible in Sonos.  The latest changes to the UI make the app even worse.

5 stars for great hardware and multi room synchronization.  0 stars for a terrible app averages to 2.5 stars hence my ‘2 star’ rating.";"2017-11-21T16:01:05-07:00";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/review?id=293523031&type=Purple%20Software";"293523031";179;"en";"NEGATIVE"

column3: grew frustrated that I could not carry my music room to room without moving my portable speaker around. The Sonos system was easy to set-up and met my needs nearly perfectly. column1: 495;5007576306;"Vi-lynn";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/reviews/id34585486";"10.4.2";1;"Shameful App Update";"I have been buying Sonos speakers for a long time and have many of their speakers.  Also I have been purchasing music through Apple iTunes for more than 15 years.
Because of this latest App update
column2: I have thousands of songs on my devices that I can no longer play straight from my device through WiFi to my Sonos speakers.  IT’S NOT RIGHT that you give us the ability to play all of our music and then TAKE IT AWAY. Now we either have to buy another SONOS component to make this work or buy a music service!  NOT a happy customer here!!

column1: Thousands spent on SONOS speakers that are now useless

column1: 496;4947026531;"amanilla12345";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/reviews/id87303758";"10.4.2";3;"Rebooting";"We have enjoyed to flexibility of Sonos through our home however being internet based rooms are dropped unexpectedly. We have to reboot the system more than often the rooms come back up
column2: but have had several times that not all the rooms come back.

column1: At this point we just wait a few days then reboot and back up  as it should be.

column2: but still enjoy the flexibility of music and room designations when everything is working as should be.";"2019-10-14T09:20:50-07:00";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/review?id=293523031&type=Purple%20Software";"293523031";106;"en";"POSITIVE"
